properties.Name: Scope3Category7EmployeeCommutingFuelBasedMethod
properties.Description:
Fuel-based method

If data is available on the quantity or amount spent on fuel by employees for commuting, companies may apply the fuel-based method. The calculation methodology for the fuel-based method is the same as the fuel-based method in category 4 (Upstream transport and distribution).

Columns.Name: LegalEntityId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Legal Entity.

Columns.Name: EmployeeCommutingTypeId
Columns.Description: The identifier of an employee commuting type.

Columns.Name: FuelTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a fuel type.

Columns.Name: FuelUsageCostAmount
Columns.Description:
The fuel usage cost amount.

Where fuel use data is unavailable, the company may derive fuel use by using the:

- Amount spent on fuels and the average price of fuels
- Distance travelled and the vehicle's fuel efficiency
- Amount spent on transportation services, fuel cost share (as percent of total cost of transportation services) and the
average price of fuels.

Columns.Name: TotalDistanceTraveledUnits
Columns.Description:
Where fuel use data is unavailable, the company may derive fuel use by using the:

- Amount spent on fuels and the average price of fuels
- Distance travelled and the vehicle's fuel efficiency
- Amount spent on transportation services, fuel cost share (as percent of total cost of transportation services) and the
average price of fuels.

Columns.Name: TransportationServicesSpentAmount
Columns.Description:
The amount of transportation services spent.

Where fuel use data is unavailable, the company may derive fuel use by using the:

- Amount spent on fuels and the average price of fuels
- Distance travelled and the vehicle's fuel efficiency
- Amount spent on transportation services, fuel cost share (as percent of total cost of transportation services) and the
average price of fuels.

Columns.Name: FuelEmissionFactorUnits
Columns.Description:
The fuel emission factor units.

Companies should collect:

- Fuel emission factors, expressed in units of emissions per unit of energy consumed (e.g., kg CO2
e/liters, CO2 e/Btu)

- For electric vehicles (if applicable), electricity emission factors, expressed in units of emissions per unit of electricity
consumed (e.g., kg CO2 e/kWh)

- Fugitive emission factors, expressed in units of emissions per unit (e.g., kg CO2 e/kg refrigerant leakage)

Columns.Name: FugitiveEmissionFactorUnits
Columns.Description:
The fugitive emission factor units.

Companies should collect:

- Fuel emission factors, expressed in units of emissions per unit of energy consumed (e.g., kg CO2
e/liters, CO2 e/Btu)

- For electric vehicles (if applicable), electricity emission factors, expressed in units of emissions per unit of electricity
consumed (e.g., kg CO2 e/kWh)

- Fugitive emission factors, expressed in units of emissions per unit (e.g., kg CO2 e/kg refrigerant leakage)

Properties.Description:
Fuel-based method

If data is available on the quantity or amount spent on fuel by employees for commuting, companies may apply the fuel-based method. The calculation methodology for the fuel-based method is the same as the fuel-based method in category 4 (Upstream transport and distribution).
